text:
Erie Basin on New York Bay between Gowanus Bay and Beard Street. Also seen at the right is Gowan's Canal extending northward. The white building in the center of the view is the New York State Barge Canal Grain Elevator.

Ewing Galloway, N.Y.

15o's
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn - [New York Bay - Between Gowanus Bay and Beard Street.]

text:
Erie Basin looking eastward to the State Barge Canal Terminal. Note the huge moving steel crane, a part of the Terminal.

1925.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn.

text:
(1)
Erie Basin, at the foot of Van Brunt Street. The 4-story structure on the left is a part of Beards Erie Basin Corporation. The ship on the right is docked at the Elder, Dempster Co. pier. Note the ferry plying between the sea wall and the warehouse.
June 6, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view.
June 6, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn - Van Brunt Street.

text:
(1)

title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn - Van Brunt Street.

text:
(1)
Erie Basin, near foot of Richards Street, showing the Elder, Dempster, West African Service pier. June 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing northeast side near Todds Shipyards. June 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing a further view eastward to the foot of Henry Street, with the New York State Barge Canal Terminal, grain elevator building there. Also shown is the O. S. K. line at Pier 3 Erie Basin.
P. L. Sperr.
June 6, 1931.
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn - Richards Street - [New York State Barge Canal Terminal.]

text:
(1)
Erie Basin, looking northeast, showing the Robbins Co. Drydocks at the extreme left.
June 6, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing at the left ships in drydock. In the background at the right is a part of a moving crane of the New York State Barge Company.
June 6, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn (Northeast).

text:
(1) & (2)
Erie Basin, south side, between Columbia Street (left) and the Upper Bay (right) showing the W.S. Webb and Sons Lumber yard in a set of two views.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, another view.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Erie Basin - Brooklyn - Between Columbia Street and Upper Bay - [W. S. Webb and Son lumber yard.]
